subject: Real Estate
title: Foreign Buyer Taxes
description: A micro-lesson that makes Foreign Buyer Taxes usable.

hook.text: Vancouver added a 20% tax on foreign home buyers in 2016. Prices dipped â€” then kept climbing.

buildup.text: Cities worldwide watched as foreign capital poured into housing, pricing out local residents.

discovery.text: Singapore charges foreigners 60% in stamp duties. New Zealand banned foreign purchases entirely.

twist.text: Buyers found workarounds: local proxies, corporate structures, and student visa loopholes.

climax.text: Foreign buyer taxes slow speculation but rarely solve affordability. Demand always finds a way in.

punchline.text: Taxing foreign buyers slows demand but never stops it.

quiz.question: How did foreign buyers often bypass purchase taxes?
options: They used proxies and corporate structures
